scheduler

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.Manager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Manager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Used to store a set of events. Instances can be read and written to file.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • deleteEvent

        public boolean deleteEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
        Remove event by name.
        Parameters:
        eventName - The name of the event to be removed.
        Returns:
        True only if Event was successfully deleted.

      • makeManager

        public static Manager makeManager(java.lang.String fileName)
        Sets up Manager. If no manager has been written to the location passed, a brand new manager is created. Else Manager is read from file contents.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Desired location to have Manager's characteristics stored.
        Returns:
        Constructed Manager

      • doesFileExist

        public static boolean doesFileExist(java.lang.String fileName)
        https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1816673/how-do-i-check-if-a-file-exists-in-java
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        Returns:
        Whether or not a file exists.

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(Event event)
        Add event to event set. Event must have unique name.
        Parameters:
        event - New event to be added.
        Returns:
        True only if the event was successfully added.

      • write

        public boolean write()
        Write class instance contents to file.
        Returns:
        True only if file was written correctly

      • read

        public static Manager read(java.lang.String fileName)
        Factory Constructor reads Manager from file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - File in which Manager is to be read from.
        Returns:
        Constructed Manager only if file was read correctly. Else null.
